title: Identify Font from Inj3ct0r
content:
Does anyone know what’s the name of this font?:  
 [http://img252.imageshack.us/img252/4369/logogreen.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114/http:/img252.imageshack.us/img252/4369/logogreen.jpg "http://img252.imageshack.us/img252/4369/logogreen.jpg")

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_green_5142.jpg)
author: DutchSpeed

comments.content:
Friends, good morning!

I need to identify this source attached, can someone help me?  
Thank you.  
 [http://dl.dropbox.com/u/37649980/pencilholder.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114/http:/dl.dropbox.com/u/37649980/pencilholder.jpg "http://dl.dropbox.com/u/37649980/pencilholder.jpg")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pencilholder_3486.jpg)

DutchSpeed, your font is Perpetua.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/perpetua/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/perpetua/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/perpetua/")

Nelson,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016011114im_/http:/typophile.com/files/newtopic_6416.gif)

Thanks!

So the damage is photoshopped, isn't? I thought the font was also damaged.
looks like they filled it with a sortof "injecting" feel. slightly Matrix-y.
